column2: Average Class Size and Class Size Distribution (Elementary)\r2016-172016-172016-172016-172017-182017-182017-182017-182018-192018-192018-192018-19\rAverage# of# of# ofAverage# of# of# ofAverage# of# of# of\rGrade\rClassClasses*Classes*Classes*ClassClasses*Classes*Classes*ClassClasses*Classes*Classes*\rLevel\rSizeSizeSizeSizeSizeSizeSizeSizeSizeSizeSizeSize\r1-2021-3233+1-2021-3233+1-2021-3233+\rK\r2442641931\r\r1\r254234234\r\r2\r221421232314\r\r3\r235245254\r\r4\r304294314\r\r5\r304304284\r\r6\r2415275294\r\rOther**\r\r*Numbe r of classes indicates how many classes fall into each size category (a range of total students per class).\r** “Other” category is for multi-grade level classes.\r\r\rProfessional Development provided for Teachers\r\rMeasure2017-182018-192019-20\rNumber of school days dedicated to Staff Development and Continuous Improvement\r\rEach year
column3: targeted professional improvement activities are provided for teachers
column5: and other employees. Activities reflect the school's\rgoals and objectives and are part of the School Plan for Student Achievement (SPSA). A variety of data reports are used to analyze growth towards\rmeeting achievement goals as described in the SPSA. Professional Development sessions are held on modified Fridays at school
column6: whole day or half day\rtrainings away from school
column7: and after school on a voluntary basis.\r\rIn 2014-15
column8: staff received PD by attending District academies and sessions provided by the site Resource Teacher.  The ELA focus has evolved to increase\rstudent achievement in reading comprehension by integrating reading and writing
column10: and speaking.  PD is on the implementation of text\rcomplexity
column12: and explicit and incidental vocabulary.  Professional Development In-services for Achieve 3000 is conducted\rto engage teachers in the full features of this program for 2nd through 6th grades.\r\rThe mathematical focus is to integrate the 8 mathematical practices with the CCSS content standards to increase student achievement.  PD is on the\rimplementation of Eureka Math and conceptual understanding along with student expertise in skills.\r\rThree hours of collaboration time two times per quarter for each grade level is provided for staff to work together in implementing the CCSS in the\rcurriculum.\r\rIn 2015-16
column13: based on CAASPP and local measure data
column14: the school's ELA focus on increasing student achievement in reading comprehension by integrating\rreading
column17: and speaking was continued.  The school Resource Teacher
column18: conducted monthly professional development for staff on the 4T's\r(text structure
column21: and implicit/explicit text vocabulary) and the 4E's (evidence
column24: and explanation) to\rsupport evidence-based responses in both speaking and writing.\r\rIn the area of math
column25: there was a continued focus on the 8 mathematical practices in conjunction with the CCSS to increase student achievement.  All\rteachers attended a summer professional development session in mathematics.  In addition
column26: our school Resource Teacher workedwith staff on\raccountable talk in the classroom with a focus on questioning
column28: and cueing to increase student discourse.\r\rFurthermore
column29: teachers were supported through multiple trainings with Achieve 3000 representatives to focus on instructional technology to support\rcritical thinking and problem-solving.\r\rTeachers also received three hours of collaboration time two times per quarter for each grade level to work together in implementing the Common Core\rState Standards and specifically focus on the areas of language and math instruction as mentioned above.\r\rIn2016-17
column31: theschool'sfocusmovedtowardmathematicalproblem-solvingtoimprovestudents\rachievement.\r\rThe District Resource Teacher met with each grade level every Friday in August and September to ensure all teachers were aware of the available math\rresources and how to use them.  ... Unnamed: 6
